intro: Aristolochia altissima, commonly known as the Dutchmanspipe, is a climbing vine native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, pipe-shaped flowers that are typically greenish-yellow with a strong, aromatic odor. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often lobed and can grow quite large. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and can become invasive in certain regions. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
